S.FORM: mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre. kai vaiyana ai 'athingale ko nomiya kai akanea ikakwata mawriva ka sin Taromaka.
mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre. kai vaiyana ai 'athingale ko nomiya kai akanea ikakwata mawriva ka sin Taromaka.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的魯凱語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Tarumake language for food.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi, nako wathingale. kalalekete so angi'elra mawriva?
sinsi, nako wathingale. kalalekete so angi'elra mawriva?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?
我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: la ccela kikai! ta angi'elana wasi'i.
la ccela kikai! ta angi'elana wasi'i.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡!跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: kisalrowa ki tabere so kwadra yakai ki thili so.
kisalrowa ki tabere so kwadra yakai ki thili so.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: akela ta kikai, kai kicakwane ta mwanga ta macecelenga lo kelanga ki takicakowakowane ta
akela ta kikai, kai kicakwane ta mwanga ta macecelenga lo kelanga ki takicakowakowane ta
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.
I am the son of Solaging, and my name is ’Aleme.

S.FORM: kiya bolro wako ki Tinebenga, siya 'Otonga. kai nagane li
kiya bolro wako ki Tinebenga, siya 'Otonga. kai nagane li
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Tinebenga, my name is ’Okoringa.

S.FORM: siya nea nagane ki tama so?
siya nea nagane ki tama so?
ko nagane ki tama li siya 'Alem.
ko nagane ki tama li siya 'Alem.
kwani ka taka li ka sawalay, siya 'Odrane.
kwani ka taka li ka sawalay, siya 'Odrane.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Tanebake.

S.FORM: eene, siya Kako kai nagane ini.
eene, siya Kako kai nagane ini.
kwani ka agi ki tinali siya Sele'e.
kwani ka agi ki tinali siya Sele'e.
kwani ka alili, siya Molisi nagane ini.
kwani ka alili, siya Molisi nagane ini.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Molisi。
She is my friend and her name is Molisi.

S.FORM: mangeale si drosa kai cayli ini.
mangeale si drosa kai cayli ini.
'iyanga kai cayli ki tama so kaiyasa?
'iyanga kai cayli ki tama so kaiyasa?
malimalrenga cayli ki tama li kaiyasa.
malimalrenga cayli ki tama li kaiyasa.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: yakai ka tadrosa ka takali ka ababay, tangea ka agili ka sawalay.
yakai ka tadrosa ka takali ka ababay, tangea ka agili ka sawalay.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個姐姐(兄)，一個弟弟(妹)。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: yakai ka taka so ka sawalay?
yakai ka taka so ka sawalay?

S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: kwani ka tamali ka agi ki tamali.
kwani ka tamali ka agi ki tamali.
ko tama so ka taka ki tina so manema kai lravai ini?
ko tama so ka taka ki tina so manema kai lravai ini?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: yakai ka lravai ki taka so ka ababay?
yakai ka lravai ki taka so ka ababay?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: eene, soTaromaka ko ka Ngodra Drekai.
eene, soTaromaka ko ka Ngodra Drekai.
ko sakacekele so miya ka kacalrisiya?
ko sakacekele so miya ka kacalrisiya?

S.TRANSL: Yes, but she is a Puyuma.

S.FORM: eene, mabelreng nai makanaelre ka wacekecekele.
eene, mabelreng nai makanaelre ka wacekecekele.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: takesikesinga ko agi so ka ababay?
takesikesinga ko agi so ka ababay?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?
Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: ma'aelre so ki tama so si tina so ikaikai?
ma'aelre so ki tama so si tina so ikaikai?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: eene, ma'aelrea ko ki tamali si tinali ikaikai.
eene, ma'aelrea ko ki tamali si tinali ikaikai.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: waki'aelre so ki tomo so si kaingo so?
waki'aelre so ki tomo so si kaingo so?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ini, kadrwa ko ki'aelre ki kolini.
ini, kadrwa ko ki'aelre ki kolini.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: ma'aelrelrea ko ki tamali, tinali si takali ka sawalay.
ma'aelrelrea ko ki tamali, tinali si takali ka sawalay.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
我們的家在撒舒而雅部落。

S.FORM: ai mobaliyo so mo cekele lroiga?
ai mobaliyo so mo cekele lroiga?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: kai taisadrasadra'a ki kaladraidraya tara mobaliyowa ko.
kai taisadrasadra'a ki kaladraidraya tara mobaliyowa ko.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: kaika makecelre kaika drangdrang kaiyasa, matharirir si kasolra'ele
kaika makecelre kaika drangdrang kaiyasa, matharirir si kasolra'ele
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: kadrowa ka emeeme sobelebeleng, walrawng kai tariyaw.
kadrowa ka emeeme sobelebeleng, walrawng kai tariyaw.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: mawgawnga, si vaivaivaynga, lrawnga kai balrilawlaw.
mawgawnga, si vaivaivaynga, lrawnga kai balrilawlaw.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: miyakakwa kai vaiyana talikai ki mosowa?
miyakakwa kai vaiyana talikai ki mosowa?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: mathariri kai vaiyana talikai ki mosowa?
mathariri kai vaiyana talikai ki mosowa?

S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

S.FORM: makecelre kai vaiyana, la tokalra'a si ki'ing.
makecelre kai vaiyana, la tokalra'a si ki'ing.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: ai tarwadraw odale lrwasa, ki karimorimoro iloko sa soko.
ai tarwadraw odale lrwasa, ki karimorimoro iloko sa soko.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.
剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: tamiya sa waodale, ni madiretheng kai kaelrea.
tamiya sa waodale, ni madiretheng kai kaelrea.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: wa odaodale? aso kadiretheng asawle kai kinawmasane so?
wa odaodale? aso kadiretheng asawle kai kinawmasane so?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: wa odaodale latadre, kai nako wailoko sa soko.
wa odaodale latadre, kai nako wailoko sa soko.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: madraw kai sasevera, angiyacaeme ki awlro li.
madraw kai sasevera, angiyacaeme ki awlro li.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: madraw kai vay, mabithengele kai awlro li takovaiya neli.
madraw kai vay, mabithengele kai awlro li takovaiya neli.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: miya neko kadro iloko, 'ila ta mwa langai.
miya neko kadro iloko, 'ila ta mwa langai.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: eene, ai tako langai yako na samosakisakidra.
eene, ai tako langai yako na samosakisakidra.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: 'ila ta langai sa rokodro sa akanea?
'ila ta langai sa rokodro sa akanea?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: ta maelelre kwane ina cabo neli.
ta maelelre kwane ina cabo neli.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: ai kane so samanema lo tokodralidraliya?
ai kane so samanema lo tokodralidraliya?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: ai kanea ko ki tokodraliya ki tatakesikesiya.
ai kanea ko ki tokodraliya ki tatakesikesiya.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: ai kane so samanema lo tokodralidraliya?
ai kane so samanema lo tokodralidraliya?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: wa'iloka ko sa cabo, ta tadrosa tokodrali.
wa'iloka ko sa cabo, ta tadrosa tokodrali.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: 'ila ta mwa malimali ki rangciyo eene?
'ila ta mwa malimali ki rangciyo eene?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: 'ila ta mwa malimali ki yakiyo eene?
'ila ta mwa malimali ki yakiyo eene?
ini, ai takesi yako ceele sa 'acase.
ini, ai takesi yako ceele sa 'acase.

S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here's a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?
I'm sweeping the floor and you asked Kacaw to carry it for you. *[Kacaw] Please change the name to men of all races.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I'll go get the cloth.
那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.
等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: lo maka takesinga ai toma neso?
lo maka takesinga ai toma neso?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: ai to'alra ko ki talragili mwa senay.
ai to'alra ko ki talragili mwa senay.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: lo maka takesinga ai tomatoma ko laso?
lo maka takesinga ai tomatoma ko laso?

S.TRANSL: Is Lisin at home, please? *[Lisin] Please change the name to an ethnic woman.
She’s at home, please come in.
Is Lisin at home, please? *[Lisin] Please change the name to an ethnic woman.
她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: nawmo, amani yako ka Tavarai, moleba.
nawmo, amani yako ka Tavarai, moleba.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I'm Panay, please open the door. *[Panay] Please change the name to an ethnic woman.

S.FORM: Solaging, Lavaoso zako, wakela ko sila'e mosowa.
Solaging, Lavaoso zako, wakela ko sila'e mosowa.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw, I'm Mayaw, I've come to play with you. *[Kacaw][Mayaw] Please change the names of the women of each tribe.

S.FORM: eene, mabarengere ko mosawa. niyama takalaelang.
eene, mabarengere ko mosawa. niyama takalaelang.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: eene, lo celeta kai akanekanea ka madro matiyadalame.
eene, lo celeta kai akanekanea ka madro matiyadalame.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: madonga kai waga ki tinali ka kwaobo, niyma kwane.
madonga kai waga ki tinali ka kwaobo, niyma kwane.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: 'alaynga kwane si ongolo, maela neso sa bazabaza.
'alaynga kwane si ongolo, maela neso sa bazabaza.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I'm full.

S.FORM: ai davacengana ko, naw kelanga ceele mosowa.
ai davacengana ko, naw kelanga ceele mosowa.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

S.FORM: eene, lo ocogo so niyamanga niyana kivaevang.
eene, lo ocogo so niyamanga niyana kivaevang.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre, ai iloka ko nomiya mo cekele ki'elaelra ki tarwarodranga.
mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre, ai iloka ko nomiya mo cekele ki'elaelra ki tarwarodranga.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: eene, ai sin Taromaka nai kikawriva ki tarwarodrang.
eene, ai sin Taromaka nai kikawriva ki tarwarodrang.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說魯凱語。
Okay! We’re going to say Ngudradrekay to the seniors.

S.FORM: naomo, wa kela nai ceele mosowa.
naomo, wa kela nai ceele mosowa.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: ya! wa thingale nomi so Taromaka, matharirir aramoro.
ya! wa thingale nomi so Taromaka, matharirir aramoro.
S.TRANSL: 你們會說魯凱語啊!真是太棒了!
You speak Tarumake! That’s great! *Please change the language to your native language.

S.FORM: mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre, ai iloka ko nomiya mwa tawbecenga twatoma.
mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre, ai iloka ko nomiya mwa tawbecenga twatoma.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: niyama tilribi makanaelre, waolringaw ta iloko na satomatomana.
niyama tilribi makanaelre, waolringaw ta iloko na satomatomana.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: eene, sinsi, wa iloko nai ina sarokorokodro.
eene, sinsi, wa iloko nai ina sarokorokodro.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre, ai yowa ta tala'ola'owa dra la golagolay kaivaiyana.
mwadringadringai nomi makanaelre, ai yowa ta tala'ola'owa dra la golagolay kaivaiyana.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: eene mathariri, ai ikakwa ta mowa.
eene mathariri, ai ikakwa ta mowa.
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: niyama kikai tilribi, ai langaynga ta sa kipo.
niyama kikai tilribi, ai langaynga ta sa kipo.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: kai cocobonga ka lazazame, kai lrikodranga ka laolawlay, angikamaniya siyavava.
kai cocobonga ka lazazame, kai lrikodranga ka laolawlay, angikamaniya siyavava.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: kadro kitoma, mwa ceele dra azazame.
kadro kitoma, mwa ceele dra azazame.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: lo lribatenga ki eea ka toki, wakela ta irobo kikai.
lo lribatenga ki eea ka toki, wakela ta irobo kikai.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: manema ka wa ceele so kaivaiyana?
manema ka wa ceele so kaivaiyana?
wa ceela ko makalra ka olawlay, si makalra ka azazame.
wa ceela ko makalra ka olawlay, si makalra ka azazame.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: adrawai li, mabalrebalre kai dra'ale li.
adrawai li, mabalrebalre kai dra'ale li.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: takalra kai omase yakai kikai lwangolangoy.
takalra kai omase yakai kikai lwangolangoy.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: madraw si mwadringi kwani acilay kawai, ta ikai kikai langolangoy.
madraw si mwadringi kwani acilay kawai, ta ikai kikai langolangoy.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: ango kai so sa manema kela?
ango kai so sa manema kela?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: ango kai yako ki baase kela.
ango kai yako ki baase kela.

S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: ai obeleng nakowa ko tama li.
ai obeleng nakowa ko tama li.
ko laso ango kai sa manema mwa tatakesikesiya?
ko laso ango kai sa manema mwa tatakesikesiya?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: ko laso wa ango kai cie'ing mwa tatakesikesiya.
ko laso wa ango kai cie'ing mwa tatakesikesiya.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: ko kaingo so wa mobeleng sa manema mwa langai ki lacenge?
ko kaingo so wa mobeleng sa manema mwa langai ki lacenge?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: ai angokai ko ki sodang mo Bocolo.
ai angokai ko ki sodang mo Bocolo.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: ko talragi so la ikakwa mo Bocolo?
ko talragi so la ikakwa mo Bocolo?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: wa mobeleng ki hikoki mo Bocolo.
wa mobeleng ki hikoki mo Bocolo.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: ango kai sa manema mo Takaw ko talragi so?
ango kai sa manema mo Takaw ko talragi so?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: ango kai ki kawti mo Takaw.
ango kai ki kawti mo Takaw.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: kai laso ango kai ki kisiya mo Balrangaw?
kai laso ango kai ki kisiya mo Balrangaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: eene, ango kai ki kisiya mo Balrangaw
eene, ango kai ki kisiya mo Balrangaw
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: ko talragi so ango kai ki kisiya mo Balrangaw?
ko talragi so ango kai ki kisiya mo Balrangaw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ini, wa mobeleng ki hikoki mo Balrangaw.
ini, wa mobeleng ki hikoki mo Balrangaw.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: kai sa'agiyaisi yakai ka tawbelebelenga ki baase?
kai sa'agiyaisi yakai ka tawbelebelenga ki baase?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: yakai, cocobonga dadavace ai ceele so.
yakai, cocobonga dadavace ai ceele so.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: kai adedethenga ka ci'yng yakai ino?
kai adedethenga ka ci'yng yakai ino?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: kadrowa ka ci'yng kikai, katha ka haiya ka mobelenge so.
kadrowa ka ci'yng kikai, katha ka haiya ka mobelenge so.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: yakai sa manema ka lisi ki salro'a idra sarakaikaiya nomi alro'o?
yakai sa manema ka lisi ki salro'a idra sarakaikaiya nomi alro'o?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: kwadra salro'a nai ka sarakaikaiya alro'a kadroy aniswasola'e ki lrabaybay.
kwadra salro'a nai ka sarakaikaiya alro'a kadroy aniswasola'e ki lrabaybay.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.
那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?
不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Tanobake, kadrowanga bava naiyana, lwalangaia bava.
Tanobake, kadrowanga bava naiyana, lwalangaia bava.
S.TRANSL: Tanobake家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

yakaiyana sadalrila ikai kwbaw, asi langai!

S.FORM: kadro ahoa sa dalrila, mwa na angivalre lwangai akoadrosa.
kadro ahoa sa dalrila, mwa na angivalre lwangai akoadrosa.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.
我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: ai langazako drosa ka dalrili bava si langaiyana sa awtiyana ka agai.
ai langazako drosa ka dalrili bava si langaiyana sa awtiyana ka agai.

S.FORM: ikai niya agai, ai langaiyana so sa manema?
ikai niya agai, ai langaiyana so sa manema?

ai lwangaiyana ako batoko, yakai nomi?

What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: ai langazako ki'ingi ka edrekai hasere.
ai langazako ki'ingi ka edrekai hasere.

We have white and blue ones too.
請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Tanobake amwa so ino kwasa? mwaongdo so?
Tanobake amwa so ino kwasa? mwaongdo so?

kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ini, amwa ko alribolo ki kaingoli langai sa laceng.
ini, amwa ko alribolo ki kaingoli langai sa laceng.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: iya! wacogo so lomaong? na karedede takane aga.
iya! wacogo so lomaong? na karedede takane aga.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。

Then, I will go with you.
你好，請問這把菜多少錢?

S.FORM: sabetebete ka laceng ka maosalre ka 'aiso.
sabetebete ka laceng ka maosalre ka 'aiso.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: matolrolo ka 'aiso ka sa tingiting ka borasi.
matolrolo ka 'aiso ka sa tingiting ka borasi.

S.FORM: na bwayiyaili drosa betebete ka laceng si sa tingiting ka borasi.
na bwayiyaili drosa betebete ka laceng si sa tingiting ka borasi.

Kelesai, marimorako iloko 'inpici, akisalro so nakowa?

kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

miyako kadro iloko, yaki Soliyape kaivai.

na kalekete so akisalro nakowa adalro? akase sawlako mosowa.

ai akisalroyana ako kai tolro ka 'acase.

kadrowa so na sawliyana nakowa idra samosakisakidra.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.
那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。

Did you lend it to kacaw?

S.FORM: nako thingale, na mwako kielaela iniya.
nako thingale, na mwako kielaela iniya.

Soliyape, kaivai sabelebelenga ki'ingi akisalro mosowa ki Kelesai?

panay, did kacaw lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ini, kaivai ka langai ko tinali kibay nakowa.
ini, kaivai ka langai ko tinali kibay nakowa.

kodra sabelebelenga ki'ingi ki Kelesai mararamaw yasono.

kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

kodra sabelebelenga ki'ingi ini ka iceceleng, makaela kolraw naiya.

Soliyape, wakisalro so ki Kelesai sa 'aiso?

eene, asanga naw sawlako kaivaiyana, marimorako kai iloko 'aiso.

eene, na 'osakaelako mosowa mariva ki Kelesai.

S.FORM: ai arakai nai taene wala toliki, ai arakai nai thelrece wala tikorai, lomiyainiya ka 'atengatenga.
ai arakai nai taene wala toliki, ai arakai nai thelrece wala tikorai, lomiyainiya ka 'atengatenga.

sika mikay, amoliyako! lamani nako maka'amala ki kaang.

lobibilrili naw bolro mosowa ikakwa dware'e kikai tadrosa ka tokolro.

eene, kathariri miniya, lobibilrili lai anako swalro'o.

mathangela kai obolo kikai cacane, mwala so kilrong ikai liba niya, naw mwa nai cacane.

ikai niya thilri ki adare, lo mwdaane liba 'adringi ai ceele so akainiya.

kilalibaka mala, kai kadola. magarange kai kilrong.

dwakale so ino yaso no tokolo.

kaivai ka soronom, arakaiya nai dakale drakeralre tokaang.

kadrowa soronom naiya, arakai nai salrakoykoyla tokaang.

nako arakaiyana salrakoykoyla lrakoyli, na bolrowaili lrakoyli bibilrili eene?

lobibilrili naw bolro ako mosowa dare'e soronom.

wavelevele lrakoyli yaso, yakai kaang kialrakoyli? kirarokodra bilribilri ki kaang.

Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: idrengera, avelevele akilingaw kai sodang, yakai yako kikai bilribirli salrakoykoyla, mwa so na kawai alibolrolraili mala na aray si kela nakowa.
idrengera, avelevele akilingaw kai sodang, yakai yako kikai bilribirli salrakoykoyla, mwa so na kawai alibolrolraili mala na aray si kela nakowa.

S.FORM: mwa bilribilra kaang twalraidra akela nakowa kikai. na osakaele ko mosowa birlibirli.
mwa bilribilra kaang twalraidra akela nakowa kikai. na osakaele ko mosowa birlibirli.

matiyakiyaragai! asiyataleke aramoro kaivaiyana, syaetenga karedrare.

ila ta sara mobaliyo akiso'ili sakacekeleta.

sici lima kai vaiyana, taisadra loza, ilata karedede kivaevang!

mwadringadringai zako! kelako silae mwswa tamasososo.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: tamali yakai kobaw toairo'a, nawa dowaolo.
tamali yakai kobaw toairo'a, nawa dowaolo.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: Laikimi amwa tatarokoka owalra ki tarokoko.
Laikimi amwa tatarokoka owalra ki tarokoko.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: tomonomi kadrwa ikai daane, yakai cacane, konomi ikaiya daane kilalava dra kaingangai.
tomonomi kadrwa ikai daane, yakai cacane, konomi ikaiya daane kilalava dra kaingangai.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: mawlainga kaita macecele, madrawngaso si kabeleng.
mawlainga kaita macecele, madrawngaso si kabeleng.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: celako mwswa sa kela mati kiaragaizako
celako mwswa sa kela mati kiaragaizako
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: kaivaika baaili mwswa ka angodrale, awanga pinsiyang.
kaivaika baaili mwswa ka angodrale, awanga pinsiyang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: mawlainga kadrwa kela , nawdawlo makanaelre karedede kwane ki aga.
mawlainga kadrwa kela , nawdawlo makanaelre karedede kwane ki aga.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: anisa kaw'ongo, aongolaili sa 'ociya sikatha, tamwa kadaana kasososo.
anisa kaw'ongo, aongolaili sa 'ociya sikatha, tamwa kadaana kasososo.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.
謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: kaivai tarokoko tawcinoloa, iloka si angilralralranga kwane.
kaivai tarokoko tawcinoloa, iloka si angilralralranga kwane.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: konako si koso tamakaketekete loza lo makatokodrali eene?
konako si koso tamakaketekete loza lo makatokodrali eene?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ikaita tatakesikesiya eene? ai kisasinta si roko'ong.
ikaita tatakesikesiya eene? ai kisasinta si roko'ong.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: tawa alrakowa mathaithariri, siyako kaki'inga mwa.
tawa alrakowa mathaithariri, siyako kaki'inga mwa.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: cekelenai kai saletale lo obengelay mathariri aramoro, lo kala obengelai koso niyamanga sila'e nakowa!
cekelenai kai saletale lo obengelay mathariri aramoro, lo kala obengelai koso niyamanga sila'e nakowa!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: wadraw akela ki kalariyariga, abilrilinga aramoro!
wadraw akela ki kalariyariga, abilrilinga aramoro!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你小米收穫祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: kielaela mwswa aso sali mobaliyo cekecekele?
kielaela mwswa aso sali mobaliyo cekecekele?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: amanisa mabarengere ako cekelelinai, anatoma kalalekete angibilri ki cekele.
amanisa mabarengere ako cekelelinai, anatoma kalalekete angibilri ki cekele.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: malrigiliso tinono. aneaka wabolro athingale mwswa.
malrigiliso tinono. aneaka wabolro athingale mwswa.
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: amani ko kaingoli, kwani malrilrigilinga tinono ikai ki cekelenai ka omase.
amani ko kaingoli, kwani malrilrigilinga tinono ikai ki cekelenai ka omase.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: ikakwasi asokisana kicakwa ki tinono amiya?
ikakwasi asokisana kicakwa ki tinono amiya?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: kakoza nai kai tinono, kiadremedremako dra kalalekete congolo ki kakoza.
kakoza nai kai tinono, kiadremedremako dra kalalekete congolo ki kakoza.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: kaivai tanobava ki beceng mathariri ongolota.
kaivai tanobava ki beceng mathariri ongolota.

S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ini, aka 'itolo ahoanga. doray aswalata olralidring akado, la aibo ki 'ikake si ciboko la wangacinga.
ini, aka 'itolo ahoanga. doray aswalata olralidring akado, la aibo ki 'ikake si ciboko la wangacinga.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: kikai yakai ka tavangolo si rakiyo, amaniako ka owadroli lre'eng.
kikai yakai ka tavangolo si rakiyo, amaniako ka owadroli lre'eng.
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: okasa ka drosa ka iday si malimale ka aiso.
okasa ka drosa ka iday si malimale ka aiso.
madalamako kikai ki'ing, iya ka aiso?
madalamako kikai ki'ing, iya ka aiso?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: kaivai ka lima ka iday ka aiso.
kaivai ka lima ka iday ka aiso.

S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?
No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: eene! bazaili sa eea icecelreng na ki'ing.
eene! bazaili sa eea icecelreng na ki'ing.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.
我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: okasa ka drosa ka kodrolo ka aiso, kaivai ka aralimako dware'e, kalalekete arakai kaolai amiyako.
okasa ka drosa ka kodrolo ka aiso, kaivai ka aralimako dware'e, kalalekete arakai kaolai amiyako.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: naw elaela ovaga ki talragili kela loangay, kalalekete toadolro sabekela?
naw elaela ovaga ki talragili kela loangay, kalalekete toadolro sabekela?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: niyama ceele! ki'ing talro'ono yakai thakathakai.
niyama ceele! ki'ing talro'ono yakai thakathakai.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: eea ka ki'ing tolro ka iday si malimale ka aiso, loatolro ka kodrolo ka aiso.
eea ka ki'ing tolro ka iday si malimale ka aiso, loatolro ka kodrolo ka aiso.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: larangazako saeea ahoanga, bwazaili dra bawva.
larangazako saeea ahoanga, bwazaili dra bawva.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: mwadringadringaiso, kisana langai ako ki binereberese si base ki lomomo.
mwadringadringaiso, kisana langai ako ki binereberese si base ki lomomo.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒湯。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and mountain Pepper Soup.

S.FORM: mwalangainga le'eng. yakaiyana ka tinpera ki tana, ai langai so?
mwalangainga le'eng. yakaiyana ka tinpera ki tana, ai langai so?
S.TRANSL: 糯米飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: eene! bwazaili sa eea, lo elanga nakelanga lwangi ki binereberese.
eene! bwazaili sa eea, lo elanga nakelanga lwangi ki binereberese.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買糯米飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: eene! nacwabo arakai ki soroido, malimale ka aiso.
eene! nacwabo arakai ki soroido, malimale ka aiso.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
